title: What I learned eating at 8,000 Chinese restaurants
description: David R Chan's decades of dining at 8,000 Chinese eateries has taught him about America and himself.

title: Ashes: England warm-up match abandoned because of rain
description: England's intra-squad Ashes warm-up match in Brisbane is abandoned without a ball being bowled on the final day because of rain.

title: What Ahmaud Arbery's murder exposes about America
description: Ahmaud Arbery died in a "modern-day lynching" - locals say the spectre of racism is always present.

title: Social care: Prime Minister's Questions claims fact-checked
description: Claims about social care, rail and employment fact-checked.

title: 100 people held more than 20 years in ‘institutions’
description: ‘If he'd murdered someone he'd be out now’ - a couple's battle to get their son out of the hospital he's been held in since 2001.

title: Pigs injure golfer and force Lightcliffe Golf Club closure
description: Golfers are forced to abandon their rounds as two runaway porkers push over golf bags and trolleys.

title: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman: Met PCs called murdered sisters 'dead birds'
description: The officers sent the messages about Nicole Smallman and Bibaa Henry to people on WhatsApp.

title: Bobbi-Anne McLeod: Brother pays tribute to sister
description: Bobbi-Anne McLeod, described as "beautiful and talented" by her brother, disappeared in Plymouth.

title: Climate crisis causing albatross divorce, says study
description: There are more bird break-ups in warmer years, a study of 15,500 breeding pairs finds.

title: No babies allowed in Commons, MP Stella Creasy told
description: A review of rules is called after Stella Creasy took her three-month-old into Westminster Hall.

title: Warning of less food choice this Christmas
description: Supply chain issues could mean consumers will have less food choice this Christmas suppliers tell MPs.

title: Vaughan will not be involved in BBC Ashes coverage
description: Former England captain Michael Vaughan will not be involved in the BBC's Ashes coverage after being named in Yorkshire racism report.

title: PC Andrew Harper's widow wins bid to change law
description: Ministers back Lissie Harper's campaign to jail those who kill on-duty police and 999 workers for life.

title: Fleck discharged from hospital after collapsing during Sheff Utd win
description: Sheffield United midfielder John Fleck is discharged from hospital after collapsing during their win away at Reading on Tuesday.

title: NFT or non-fungible token is Collins Dictionary's word of the year
description: "Neopronoun", "cheugy" and "climate anxiety" also make this year's list.

title: Windrush survivor: Will we get government compensation before we die?
description: A report by MPs says the Home Office should be stripped of running the Windrush compensation scheme.

title: Karim Benzema: French footballer guilty in sex tape blackmail case
description: The Real Madrid striker is convicted of conspiring to blackmail fellow footballer Mathieu Valbuena.

title: China: Photographer sorry for 'small eyes' Dior picture
description: Some Chinese netizens found her photo insulting and racist as it showed a woman with small eyes.

title: Angry Murphy says 'amateurs should not be allowed in pro tournaments' - and Robertson agrees
description: Former winner Shaun Murphy suffers a monumental shock in the first round of the UK Championship, losing 6-5 to Chinese amateur Si Jiahui.

title: Kerala adoption row: A mother's search for her missing baby in India
description: A mother's search for a missing baby in India has caused outrage and whipped up a political storm.

title: Hertfordshire Bronze Age axe hoard found by girl detectorist
description: On her third metal-detecting trip, Milly finds a Bronze Age hoard dating from about 1300BC.

title: Bowling coach Cooley to help England prepare for Ashes
description: Troy Cooley, one of the architects of England's famous 2005 Ashes win, will help Joe Root's side prepare for the upcoming series down under.

title: Blackpool nurses brave daily cold water challenge for cancer charity
description: Friends Anne Aitken and Pia Ashton raise more than £13,000 by dipping in cold water in November.

title: Adam Hughes welcomes brain injury clinics, but brands World Rugby video as 'patronising'
description: A former professional rugby player, who had to retire due to brain injuries, dubs part of World Rugby's latest brain health campaign "patronising".

title: The universal credit claimants effectively paying top tax rates
description: Officially, the highest tax rate is 45% - but workers can end up paying more.

title: GCHQ: How being a spy helps me with online dating
description: A new recruit tells us about her work as GCHQ try to sign up more women and minority trainees.

title: Hawkeye: A Marvel TV show about a superhero with impostor syndrome
description: Jeremy Renner returns as the Avengers' archer to explore his 'human' role in the Marvel universe.

title: Farm laws: Sikhs being targeted by fake social media profiles
description: A total of 80 accounts have been suspended following a report into the network.

title: Knife crime: Following a mum's journey burying her child
description: Campaigners say London could see its worst year for youth killings for more than a decade.

title: Rescuing the Afghanistan girls' football team
description: The mission to rescue the national Afghan girls' football team from the Taliban.

title: CEO Secrets: From Ordsall poverty to being a billionaire
description: Peter Done, co-founder of Betfred and CEO of Peninsula, shares his business advice for CEO Secrets.

title: Leeds teacher helps give 1,400 children a place to sleep
description: Bex Wilson, from Leeds, started the charity Zarach after realising some pupils did not have a bed.

title: LGBT in Poland: I still can't be myself
description: Provinces recently started to backtrack on "LGBT-free zones" after the EU threatened to freeze funds.

title: Covid and Brexit shrink Christmas markets
description: The UK's annual European Christmas markets will have fewer stalls and traders due to Brexit and the pandemic
